meanings.definition: The normal state of balanced tension in the tissues of the body, especially the muscles.
meanings.sent1: Her physical therapist assessed her tonus to ensure her muscles were in good condition.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise helps maintain proper tonus in the muscles.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor joked that achieving tonus was like finding the perfect balance in a game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: His tonus was like a coiled spring, ready to propel him forward at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's tonus was so evident in her graceful movements on stage.

meanings.definition: The normal degree of vigor and tension in a muscle or group of muscles.
meanings.sent1: The athlete's tonus was evident as he sprinted towards the finish line.
meanings.sent2: Proper warm-up exercises help increase tonus before a workout.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tonus was so high that it pounced on the toy mouse with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: His tonus was like a tightly wound spring, ready to unleash energy at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The tonus in her biceps showed her dedication to weightlifting.

meanings.definition: The normal state of elastic tension or partial contraction in resting muscles.
meanings.sent1: During relaxation exercises, focus on maintaining tonus in your muscles.
meanings.sent2: The tonus in his forearms indicated his readiness to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear's tonus was so relaxed that it slumped over in the toy chest.
meanings.sent4: The tonus in the rubber band was just enough to hold the papers together without snapping.
meanings.sent5: The tonus in her shoulders eased as she practiced deep breathing exercises.
